rev.comment: Reverted to revision 457823977 by OreL.D: unsourced section. ([[WP:TW|TW]])
/* War and Counter-Revolution (1792–1797) */ Split "La Marseillaise" from one long ungrammatical sentence.
[Pu408]Tweak: title. Combined duplicate references. You can [[WP:UCB|use this bot]] yourself. [[WP:DBUG|Report bugs here]].
/* Legacy */ Adding sentence to capture point made by Riemer and Simon
Reordering lead to keep France-specific text together and put "impact on history" at the end
"political upheaval" assumes "major changes". Also I'd argue that "citizenship" incorporates "nationalism" and '(briefly) democracy' sounds a bit judgmental
corrected 'left-wing' to historical meaning/origination of the term
/* War in the Vendée */ rm parenthesese, recast response to Secher to better match the vendée article.
/* War in the Vendée */ Removing subtle irony.
[[:en:WP:CLEANER|WPCleaner]] (v1.09) Repaired link to disambiguation page - [[WP:DPL|(You can help)]] - [[Nancy]]
Rmvd unnec. qualifying remarks & wikilinks. Something "unparalleled" can't be "along side" something else.
Attempt to amplify legacy by giving the repeat of the absolutism-constitutional monarchy-republic-empire

specified monarchy, aristocracy and religion as the old ideas, as what would have particularly outraged people and provoked war, for instance as distinguished from the american revolution - as well as equality and democracy as new ideas
Clarified that this revolution saw a number of changing and varied regimes, differentiating it from most other revolutions
Added the occasional alternative title 'The Great French Revolution' to help distinguish it from the later 19th century revolutions and helps suggets that 1789-99 comprised a series of revolutions
/* Execution of Louis XVI */ Adding wikis
/* Constitutional crisis */ Clarified assaulting force, elections to Convention

Reverted [[WP:AGF|good faith]] edits by [[Special:Contributions/Fabartus|Fabartus]] ([[User talk:Fabartus|talk]]): Way to flowery prose. Please try and word it more neutrally. Perhaps read [[WP:WEASELWORD]]. ([[WP:TW|TW]])
a legacy mention--the weird dates are used so there genesis helps explain such
work the end event into lead and a few other tweaks to properly provide proper perspective and pertinent historical relativity
Reverted 1 edit by [[Special:Contributions/Stephfo|Stephfo]] ([[User talk:Stephfo|talk]]): You will need to change consensus for this at the talk page, then. ([[WP:TW|TW]])
/* Reign of Terror */ preferable in this context
/* Women's March on Versailles */ preferred to 'convince of' something. Persuade is preferable here.

Good faith removal: unnecessary reiterated content added ([[WP:HG|HG]])

I'm well aware that they're all in the rest of the article itself. But for a quick run-down and reference, for casual readers, or those who may not have time to mill through whole article...deleting is against WP policy without talking first...

Reverted [[WP:AGF|good faith]] edits by [[Special:Contributions/Hashem sfarim|Hashem sfarim]] ([[User talk:Hashem sfarim|talk]]): Unnecessary with a table, since it is all gone into in greater detail in the article text. ([[WP:TW|TW]])
left/right terms were invented in 1790s to describe this split
Undid revision 433150643 by [[Special:Contributions/Motorizer|Motorizer]] ([[User talk:Motorizer|talk]])we can't call something by terms that post-date it
Terms more suitable as they stem from the Revolution itself
/* Failure of the constitutional monarchy */ Added "citation-needed" to counts associated with Feuillant, Girondist and Jacobin factions
/* Causes */ Augmented passage about bad weather/harvests with references to [[El Niño]], [[Laki]] and [[Grímsvötn]]
[[WP:MOSNUM|align date formats]] by [[User:Ohconfucius/MOSNUM dates.js|script]]; per [[WP:MOS]], [[WP:MOSTEXT]] and [[WP:Linking]]
/* Estates-General of 1789 */ Expanding mention of Sieyes

Undid revision 423758858 by [[Special:Contributions/Frania Wisniewska|Frania Wisniewska]] ([[User talk:Frania Wisniewska|talk]]) Pamphlets did report factual information as well, but offered critical interpretations of said information
/* Causes */ removed "often" as pamphlets not "often" but "always" report false and/or exagerated information, underlying the negative
/* The Constitutional Republic: The Directory (1795–1799) */ name of *house* before number of members
/* The Constitutional Republic: The Directory (1795–1799) */ Fixed confusing punctuation about the two houses of La Directoire.

Undid revision 423504042 by [[Special:Contributions/Eldamorie|Eldamorie]] ([[User talk:Eldamorie|talk]]) - Firstly, billion has two meanings; even with the more common one, just for clarity. Also, it is arguable, therefore 1000-2000 million.
Undid revision 423435690 by [[Special:Contributions/Kfodderst|Kfodderst]] ([[User talk:Kfodderst|talk]]) 2 billion is significantly simpler

Undid revision 423166955 by [[Special:Contributions/Silverhorse|Silverhorse]] ([[User talk:Silverhorse|talk]]) -- Strongly debatable, and not true anyway - ideological, political and economical roots began prior to the 14th of July.

/* Hercules */ No apparent reason to indent all the paragraphs in this section
/* Symbolism in the French Revolution */ punctuation
/* The Constitutional Republic: The Directory (1795–1799) */ some copyedits; rm a phrase that doesn't seem to add much
/* The guillotine as a symbol */ punctuation
/* War in the Vendée */ Normal English-language way of writing numbers (comma for thousands)
/* Revolution and the Church */ While Robespierre ended the Cult of Reason, he instituted the Cult of the Supreme Being
/* Storming of the Bastille */ italicize French
/* Storming of the Bastille */ parentheses rather than square brackets
/* Revolution and the Church */ copyedit a sentence for clarity
/* Financial crisis */ sorry, that's [[House of Bourbon|Bourbon monarchy]]
/* Financial crisis */ changing a semi-colon to a comma (minor after major)
/* Financial crisis */ It was the state, rather than the nation, that was nearing bankruptcy
/* Causes */ No need for ''falsely'' to be in parentheses; link to clarify ''Austrian''
/* Causes */ copyedits in a caption: clarify that the financial crisis of the 1780s was a government fiscal crisis
clarify relation of Robespierre to Terror (in lede)
/* The Constitutional Republic: The Directory (1795–1799) */ add cite

repaired link(s) to disambiguation page - ([[Wikipedia:Disambiguation pages with links|you can help]])

not exactly a "result" of the Revolution
not "other names" - refers to two separate events.

The number of people killed during the Reign of Terror

And how exactly does bankruptcy weaken a state or lead to a revolution in and of itself?

/* Execution of Louis XVI */ Marie Antoinette was executed months later, during the terror. Her execution should not be mentioned in this section
/* Execution of Louis XVI */ drop the bloody stuff (and the quote from a non-expert)

well, that was the result in 1799
subject of education assignment. This will be taken down this monday, feel free to msg me if any issues come up
"replace altogether the Church" seemed awkward; rephrasing
A tithe is "a tax equal to one-tenth of the total". "A tenth tax" is "the tax that comes after the ninth tax". Changing "tenth tax" to "10% tax".
Word choice: "pieces of cannon" seems to be an archaic term. Today we would say "cannons". Minor edit because it doesn't change the meaning.
not" *Royalist* efforts" but "*royal* efforts"/ no use for multi linking *Jacobins*/
